text: [Dave]: Erin was with me in the cafeteria, so she can vouch for me; where were you, Bob, when Charlie was killed in Medbay?
[Bob]: Dave, I saw you kill Alice in the cafeteria, then I ran to Medbay where I found Charlie's body – you're lying about being with Erin.
[Charlie]: Bob is telling the truth, I saw Dave kill Alice too, then we both ran to Medbay.
[Erin]: Dave is lying, I only saw him doing a task earlier, then I saw him kill Alice in the cafeteria – Bob and Charlie are telling the truth, vote Dave.
[Dave]: Erin, you're saying I killed Alice *after* you saw me doing a task, so which task did you see me do, because that proves I was acting like a crewmate and not an impostor.
[Bob]: Dave, stop trying to deflect –  Erin clearly stated she saw you do a task *before* she witnessed you murdering Alice, proving you're the impostor.
[Charlie]: Dave, you're clearly trying to confuse us with irrelevant details – we all saw you kill Alice, so let's just vote you out and get back to our tasks.
[Erin]: I saw Dave complete the "Start the coffee maker" task right before he killed Alice in the cafeteria.
[Dave]: Erin, you only saw me *start* the coffee maker, not finish it, which means it wasn't actually complete and doesn't prove anything.
[Bob]: Dave, whether you finished the task or not is irrelevant, three people saw you kill Alice – your game is over.
[Charlie]: Dave, it's three against one, we all saw you kill Alice, just admit it and let's vote.
[Erin]: Dave, you're desperately trying to distract us from the fact that three people witnessed you kill Alice; your attempts to discredit our statements are failing.
[Dave]: If three people "saw" me kill Alice, why didn't any of you report the body immediately, instead choosing to run to Medbay where conveniently another body appears?
[Bob]: Dave, you're grasping at straws; three of us saw you kill Alice, and your attempts to deflect blame are pathetic.
[Charlie]: Dave, your question about reporting the body is a blatant attempt to deflect from the fact that three of us witnessed you murder Alice.
[Erin]: Dave, your attempts to deflect blame by questioning our actions after witnessing you kill Alice are transparent and only further solidify your guilt.
[Dave]: So, Bob and Charlie, if you both saw me kill Alice, why did you run to Medbay together instead of reporting the body or calling a meeting immediately?
[Bob]: Dave, your repeated attempts to shift the focus away from the fact that three people witnessed you murdering Alice only strengthens our resolve to vote you out.
[Charlie]: Dave,  your desperate attempts to create reasonable doubt are failing; three of us saw you kill Alice, so just accept the inevitable and let's vote.
[Erin]: Dave, your repeated questioning of why we ran is a classic diversion tactic to avoid the core issue: three of us saw you murder Alice.
